channel.title: Im back with qestions
channel.description: howdy! i haven't played mopar for ages, so i need 1 question. When i start a private client i execute RUN.bat and on every single one it writes JAVA isnt recognized command.

item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Error: SignLink:233 SignLink:372 Applet_Sub1:338 client:2196 | java.lang.Runtime Exception Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.NullPointerException at Applet_Sub1.method20(Applet_Sub1.java:280) at Applet_Sub1.destroy(Applet_Sub1.java:601) at Applet_Sub1.windowClosing(Applet_Sub1.java:581) at java.awt.Window.processWindowEvent(Unknown Source) at java.awt.Window.processEvent(Unknown Source) at java.awt.Component.dispatchEventImpl(Unknown Source) at java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl(Unknown Source) at java.awt.Window.dispatchEventImpl(Unknown Source) at java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source) at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(Unknown Source)[/quote]

item.title: Im back with qestions
item.dc:creator: @HOT_babe HOT babe
item.description:
@HOT_babe wrote:

i know it but the prob is with clients on my pc all of them write this shi*

The system cannot find the path specified. 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Im back with qestions
item.dc:creator: @Who_Tank Who Tank
item.description:
@Who_Tank wrote:

@echo off
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac *.java
pause

okay, thats a basic compiler
now go to

C:\Program Files\Java\

on your computer
and it will say something like

jdk1.6.0_11

those last 2 digits are the verison number

insert version number into the compiler above.

(: no problem

Read full topic

item.title: Im back with qestions
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Change the JAVA version in the Compiler to your current JAVA version.
